newsitem.title: USA: Kansas feedlot cattle market thin at $68 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas feedlot cattle market thin at $68 - USDA.

text.p: Trade was moderate early Thursday, USDA said. Slaughter steers and heifers fully steady. Inquiry and demand moderate. Sales confirmed 3,900 slaughter steers and 3,900 slaughter heifers Wednesday. For the week to date on 130,000 head confirmed including 21,900 head or about 17 percent previously contracted or formulated cattle and CME delivery cattle. Sales FOB feedlot net weights after 4 percent shrink.
Dressed basis: Select and Choice 2-3 1225 lbs 108.00, hot
Dressed basis: Select and Choice 2-3 1100-1155 lbs 108.00, hot weights, delivered.
